summaries.brief_summary: Resolved cyclic dependency issue in v0.18~preview.130.50+1016
summaries.activity_summary: Closed cyclic dependency issue caused by multiple opam repository configuration
summaries.activity: - **Cyclic dependency issue** in v0.18~preview.130.50+1016 resolved where ppxlib and ppxlib_jane had circular dependencies, caused by having both janestreet-bleeding and ox opam repositories in the same switch ([#74](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/74))
summaries.contributors_summary: Issue reported by Gopher and resolved through repository configuration guidance
summaries.contributors: - [Gopher](https://github.com/irategopher) reported cyclic dependency issue affecting bonsai package installation ([#74](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/74))

summaries.brief_summary: Cyclic dependency issue reported for ppxlib and ppxlib_jane packages in v0.18~preview.130.50+1016
summaries.activity_summary: One new issue opened regarding cyclic dependencies in preview package versions
summaries.activity: - **Package dependency issue** reported by [Gopher](https://github.com/irategopher) involving cyclic dependencies between ppxlib and ppxlib_jane packages in v0.18~preview.130.50+1016 ([#74](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/74))
summaries.discussions_summary: Discussion about ppxlib and ppxlib_jane dependency differences between repositories
summaries.notable_discussions: - **Dependency analysis** discussion by [Gopher](https://github.com/irategopher) comparing ppxlib_jane dependencies between janestreet/opam-repository and oxcaml/opam-repository, highlighting version constraint differences that may cause cyclic dependency conflicts ([#74](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/74))
summaries.contributors_summary: One contributor reported package dependency issues and provided analysis
summaries.contributors: - [Gopher](https://github.com/irategopher) reported cyclic dependency issues in preview packages ([#74](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/74)) and provided detailed analysis comparing dependency constraints between different opam repositories

- **Version bump release** to v0.18~preview.130.50+1016 updating package versions across the entire Jane Street ecosystem ([2bd4fc7](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/2bd4fc7121ad1a58419f2c5f6eba929e044b4041))
summaries.contributors_summary: Vincent Laviron contributed dependency fix and automated release process updated versions
summaries.contributors:

- Automated release process by public-release updated all package versions to v0.18~preview.130.50+1016 ([2bd4fc7](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/2bd4fc7121ad1a58419f2c5f6eba929e044b4041))

summaries.brief_summary: One PR opened to fix ocaml_simd package build issues
summaries.activity_summary: Single PR opened addressing compiler version update and build fixes

summaries.contributors_summary: Max Slater opened one PR with compiler and build fixes
summaries.contributors: - [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) opened PR to update compiler version to 5.2.0minus-11 with fixes for ocaml_simd bytecode compatibility and ppxlib_ast sandbox issues ([#72](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/72))

summaries.brief_summary: Build system improvements and repository maintenance with significant package updates and macOS compatibility fixes
summaries.new_features_summary: Shell script permission fix for macOS builds and documentation updates for compiler dependency requirements
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed **shell script permission issue** affecting macOS builds by avoiding reliance on executable permissions in ppxlib_ast cleanup script ([#71](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/71))
- Updated **installation documentation** with autoconf dependency requirements for Ubuntu and macOS platforms ([37164df](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/37164df1249563ceadf6887230ee817b32fda6b3))
- **Rebranded repository references** from flambda2 to ox throughout documentation and package naming conventions ([37164df](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/37164df1249563ceadf6887230ee817b32fda6b3))
summaries.activity_summary: Extensive package version updates from v0.18~preview.130.33+516 to v0.18~preview.130.36+326 across Jane Street libraries with patch improvements
summaries.activity:
- **Package version synchronization** across entire Jane Street ecosystem with systematic updates from v0.18~preview.130.33+516 to v0.18~preview.130.36+326 affecting core, async, bonsai, and dozens of other libraries
- **macOS compatibility improvements** by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) including basement stubs fixes ([#67](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/67)), parallel stubs fixes ([#65](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/65)), core_unix and heartbeat stubs updates ([#64](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/64)), and basement patch adjustments ([#63](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/63), [#62](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/62))
- **Build system fixes** by [Joel Reymont](https://github.com/joelreymont) addressing posix_spawn permission denied errors on macOS through shell script permission handling improvements ([#71](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/71))
- **CI/CD workflow development** by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) with GitHub Actions for testing package installations, though both PRs were closed to redirect to the oxcaml repository ([#69](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/69), [#68](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/68))
summaries.trends_summary: Repository transition from jst to ox naming conventions with focus on macOS platform stability
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Systematic rebranding effort** from Jane Street internal (`+jst`) to OxCaml (`+ox`) package suffixes across the entire ecosystem
- **macOS platform focus** with multiple PRs addressing platform-specific build issues and compatibility improvements
- **Infrastructure consolidation** with CI/CD workflow discussions indicating centralization efforts toward the oxcaml repository
summaries.contributors_summary: Three active contributors focused on build system fixes, package maintenance, and CI workflow development
summaries.contributors:
- [Joel Reymont](https://github.com/joelreymont) identified and fixed **shell script permission issues** affecting macOS builds ([#70](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/70), [#71](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/71))
- [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) delivered comprehensive **macOS compatibility improvements** with multiple patch updates for basement, parallel, core_unix, and heartbeat components ([#62](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/62), [#63](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/63), [#64](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/64), [#65](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/65), [#66](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/66), [#67](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/67))
- [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) developed **GitHub Actions workflows** for automated package testing and participated in repository workflow discussions before redirecting efforts to the oxcaml repository ([#68](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/68), [#69](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/69))
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) maintains ongoing **js_of_ocaml toplevel** patches for JavaScript extensions compatibility ([#55](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/55))
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) continues work on **ppx_deriving** OxCaml compatibility ([#49](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/49))
- [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) provides **async_ssl** patches for modern toolchain compatibility ([#37](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/37))

summaries.brief_summary: Two build-related issues reported by [Nathan Farlow](https://github.com/nathanfarlow) for ocaml-index and base packages
summaries.activity_summary: Two compilation issues reported affecting ocaml-index with OPAMJOBS=1 and base v0.17.2 syntax errors
summaries.activity:
- **Compilation issue** with ocaml-index.1.1+jst reported by [Nathan Farlow](https://github.com/nathanfarlow) when using OPAMJOBS=1, suggesting missing yojson dependency ([#61](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/61))
- **Syntax error** in base v0.17.2 preventing ocaml-lsp-server installation reported by [Nathan Farlow](https://github.com/nathanfarlow), with workaround using base.v0.18~preview.130.33+516 ([#60](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/60))
summaries.contributors_summary: [Nathan Farlow](https://github.com/nathanfarlow) reported two compilation issues affecting package installation
summaries.contributors: - [Nathan Farlow](https://github.com/nathanfarlow) identified and reported compilation issues with ocaml-index dependency handling ([#61](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/61)) and base package syntax errors ([#60](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/60)), providing detailed error logs and workarounds

summaries.brief_summary: Jane Street opam repository updated with v0.18~preview.130.33+516 release affecting 200+ packages, plus utop fixes and mdx support
summaries.new_features_summary: Major package version release with extensive opam file updates across all Jane Street packages
summaries.new_features:
- **Package version update** to `v0.18~preview.130.33+516` across 200+ Jane Street packages with opam file dependency updates and version bump ([2819773](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/2819773f29b6f6c14b918eae3cb40c8ff6b22d0e))
- **MDX support** added for version 2.5.0 with OxCaml compiler compatibility including AST and type exposure changes ([#56](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/56))
- **UTop crash fix** for module definitions with enum types, resolving fatal exception in autoprinter functionality ([#59](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/59))
summaries.activity_summary: One ongoing ppx_deriving compatibility fix with additional work on package installation issues
summaries.activity:
- **PPX compatibility work** ongoing with [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) addressing ppx_deriving compilation issues with OxCaml and ppxlib.0.33.0 compatibility ([#49](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/49))
- **Package installation debugging** by [Nathan Farlow](https://github.com/nathanfarlow) identifying base v0.17.2 compilation failures and providing workaround with preview version ([#60](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/60))
- **UTop stability improvements** completed with [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) fixing autoprinter crashes through proper error handling ([#59](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/59))
- **Tool integration** enhanced by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) adding mdx 2.5.0 support with required AST and type changes for OxCaml compatibility ([#56](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/56))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on OxCaml compiler compatibility and package ecosystem stability
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **OxCaml integration** becoming primary focus with multiple packages requiring compatibility updates for the experimental compiler variant
- **Package ecosystem maintenance** intensifying with systematic version bumps and dependency management across the entire Jane Street package collection
- **Cross-repository collaboration** evident in ppx_deriving fix discussions involving compatibility requirements with upstream ppxlib versions
summaries.contributors_summary: Four contributors working on compiler compatibility, package maintenance, and bug fixes
summaries.contributors:
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) led development efforts with two merged PRs fixing utop crashes ([#47](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/47), [#59](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/59)) and ongoing ppx_deriving compatibility work ([#49](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/49))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) identified critical utop bug with module definitions ([#58](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/58)) and provided testing verification for the fix ([#59](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/59))
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) contributed mdx tool integration with comprehensive AST and type changes for OxCaml compiler support ([#56](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/56))
- [Nathan Farlow](https://github.com/nathanfarlow) reported package installation issues with base library compilation failures and documented workaround solutions ([#60](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/60))

summaries.brief_summary: Major repository restructuring with dune pkg compatibility and platform-specific fixes for macOS
summaries.new_features_summary: Dune package management support and improved macOS/NixOS compatibility
summaries.new_features:
- **Dune package management compatibility** by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) reorganizing folder structure to packages/pkg/pkg.X.Y.Z format enabling `dune pkg` workflows alongside traditional opam ([#54](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/54))
- **macOS ARM64 and x86_64 runtime fixes** including huge pages compilation fix and stack overflow handler patches ([ef132525](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/ef132525ed070c3a083a26a65d5750f8725ed35c))
- **NixOS script compatibility** by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) using `/usr/bin/env bash` instead of `/bin/bash` for POSIX compliance ([#57](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/57))
- **Simplified tool installation** with updated README.md by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) allowing `opam install ocamlformat merlin` without hardcoded version strings ([#52](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/52))
- **MDX 2.5.0 support** by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) with AST and type compatibility changes for oxcaml compiler ([#56](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/56))
summaries.activity_summary: Repository restructuring, platform compatibility improvements, and build system enhancements
summaries.activity:
- **New pull request opened** for ppx_deriving compilation fixes by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) to make ppx_deriving work with OxCaml without adding extension support ([#49](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/49))
- **Major restructuring merged** including dune pkg compatibility, package folder reorganization from packages/pkg.X.Y.Z to packages/pkg/pkg.X.Y.Z structure, removal of init-* packages from PATH pollution, and init-compiler upgrade to 4.14.2 ([#54](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/54))
- **Platform compatibility improvements** with NixOS script fixes merged ([#57](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/57)) and README.md documentation updates ([#52](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/52))
- **MDX support completion** with version 2.5.0 merged enabling markdown documentation processing with oxcaml compiler ([#56](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/56))
- **ARM64 runtime patches** including macOS fixes for huge pages compilation and x86_64 stack overflow handling improvements
- **Build system cleanup** removing outdated META files and bootstrapping packages while maintaining opam switch compatibility
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on cross-platform compatibility and modern build system integration
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Build system modernization** with dune package management integration allowing dependency management directly from dune without opam binary requirements
- **Cross-platform robustness** addressing macOS compilation issues and NixOS compatibility for broader OCaml with extensions adoption
- **Development workflow improvements** simplifying tool installation and removing version pinning complexity for better developer experience
- **Package management evolution** transitioning from init-* bootstrap packages to cleaner package structure while maintaining backward compatibility
summaries.contributors_summary: Four contributors delivered infrastructure improvements and platform fixes
summaries.contributors:
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) led **repository restructuring** implementing dune pkg compatibility ([#54](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/54)) and opened ppx_deriving compilation fixes ([#49](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/49))
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) implemented **MDX 2.5.0 support** with AST and type exposure changes for oxcaml compiler compatibility ([#56](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/56))
- [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) contributed **NixOS compatibility** by updating script shebangs for POSIX compliance ([#57](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/57))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) improved **documentation** by removing hardcoded version strings from README.md installation instructions ([#52](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/52))
- [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) proposed ARM64 runtime fixes that were incorporated into the compiler patches for effects and locals stack corruption resolution

summaries.brief_summary: Major repository reorganization enabling dune pkg compatibility and compiler upgrade to OCaml 4.14.2
summaries.new_features_summary: Package layout restructured for dune pkg support, OCaml compiler upgraded to 4.14.2, init packages removed
summaries.new_features:
- **Repository layout restructured** for dune package management compatibility by moving packages from `packages/pkg.X.Y.Z` to `packages/pkg/pkg.X.Y.Z` format, enabling direct dependency management through dune ([#54](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/54))
- **OCaml compiler upgraded** from 4.14.1 to 4.14.2 to resolve compilation issues on Arch Linux with recent GCC versions ([28cdd2a](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/28cdd2a7703f3e840f7ae33f4624f0acf0f8c2e6))
- **Bootstrap packages removed** from general availability - init-compiler, init-dune, and init-menhir packages are now only available during OCaml compiler installation to prevent PATH pollution ([28cdd2a](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/28cdd2a7703f3e840f7ae33f4624f0acf0f8c2e6))
- **Multiple library patches** applied including fixes for alcotest local restrictions, lwt_ppx compilation issues, and utop compatibility ([#46](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/46), [#47](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/47), [#48](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/48))
- **Installation documentation updated** to avoid hardcoded preview version strings and use dynamic opam repository discovery ([#52](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/52))
summaries.activity_summary: Package compatibility fixes merged with extensive JS_of_OCaml toplevel work and ppx_deriving compatibility improvements ongoing
summaries.activity:
- **Dune package management compatibility** achieved through comprehensive repository restructuring by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w), moving 931 files and removing outdated bootstrap packages to enable seamless integration with dune pkg workflows ([#54](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/54))
- **Core library fixes merged** including alcotest patch for local value restrictions by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) ([#46](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/46)), utop compilation fixes ([#47](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/47)), and lwt_ppx compatibility improvements ([#48](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/48))
- **Documentation improvements** completed by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) updating README.md installation instructions to use dynamic version discovery instead of hardcoded preview strings ([#52](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/52))
- **Base library dependencies** standardized with forced preview version requirements implemented across multiple packages ([#51](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/51))
- **Large-scale JS_of_OCaml toplevel integration** work in progress by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) applying comprehensive patches for toplevel functionality with JS extensions, involving 81 changed files and 8,396 additions ([#55](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/55))
- **PPX_deriving compatibility** work ongoing by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) to enable compilation with OxCaml extensions, though not yet adding full extension support ([#49](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/49))
summaries.discussions_summary: Uniqueness mode compilation issues being debugged with switch creation and dune version compatibility problems
summaries.notable_discussions: - **Uniqueness mode compilation discrepancy** reported by [Onur Şahin](https://github.com/onsah) where LSP shows no errors but dune build fails with "aliased but expected to be unique" errors, leading to investigation of switch setup and dune version compatibility issues ([#44](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/44))
summaries.contributors_summary: Three main contributors delivered repository infrastructure improvements, library fixes, and documentation updates
summaries.contributors:
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) led the technical work with repository restructuring for dune pkg compatibility ([#54](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/54)), multiple library fixes for alcotest ([#46](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/46)), utop ([#47](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/47)), and lwt_ppx ([#48](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/48)), plus ongoing ppx_deriving compatibility work ([#49](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/49))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) improved documentation and dependency management by updating README.md installation instructions ([#52](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/52)) and implementing base library preview version requirements ([#51](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/51))
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) contributed extensive JS_of_OCaml toplevel integration work applying patches for toplevel functionality with JS extensions ([#55](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/55))
- [Onur Şahin](https://github.com/onsah) provided feedback and testing by reporting uniqueness mode compilation issues and helping debug switch setup problems ([#44](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/44))

summaries.brief_summary: Package release with ARM64 runtime fixes and community discussion on uniqueness mode implementation
summaries.new_features_summary: Package version update with ARM64 fixes and new float_array, oklab, simple_xml, toplayer packages
summaries.new_features:
- **Package version release** `v0.18~preview.130.31+242` including updates to core Jane Street libraries and addition of new packages: `float_array`, `oklab`, `simple_xml`, and `toplayer` ([fd6d4f2](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/fd6d4f29cc5f0e56ed2f1f0058a6cee547b715f8))
- **ARM64 runtime improvements** for effects and locals handling, addressing corrupted local stack issues and segfaults on ARM64 architecture ([#45](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/45))
summaries.activity_summary: New PR for ARM64 runtime fixes opened, with ongoing community discussions about uniqueness mode behavior
summaries.activity:
- **ARM64 runtime fix** PR opened by [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) to backport critical changes from flambda-backend for effects and locals on ARM64 ([#45](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/45))
- **Package maintenance** activities including closure of previous ARM64 build fix PR that was superseded by compiler updates ([#36](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/36))
summaries.discussions_summary: Community engagement on uniqueness mode implementation and local switch creation issues
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Uniqueness mode behavior** discussion initiated by [Onur Şahin](https://github.com/onsah) reporting unexpected compiler behavior with unique annotations, with [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) providing troubleshooting assistance and example implementations ([#44](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/44))
- **Borrowing implementation status** inquiry by [Onur Şahin](https://github.com/onsah) about Rust-style borrowing operators, with [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) explaining current implementation status and timeline ([#43](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/43))
- **Local switch creation issue** reported by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) regarding dune-project compatibility problems, with technical analysis from [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) on dune build flags ([#42](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/42))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on ARM64 platform support and addressing uniqueness mode implementation challenges
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **ARM64 platform focus** with multiple PRs addressing runtime and build issues for ARM64 architecture, indicating priority on cross-platform compatibility
- **Uniqueness mode adoption** showing active community testing of experimental ownership features, revealing implementation gaps between LSP and compiler behavior
- **Toolchain integration challenges** highlighted by dune version compatibility issues affecting local switch creation workflows
summaries.contributors_summary: Matthew Else led ARM64 fixes, Onur Şahin engaged in uniqueness discussions, Cuihtlauac Alvarado reported tooling issues
summaries.contributors:
- [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) contributed ARM64 runtime fixes by opening PR to backport effects and locals improvements ([#45](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/45)), provided troubleshooting guidance for uniqueness mode issues ([#44](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/44)), and closed superseded ARM64 build fix PR ([#36](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/36))
- [Onur Şahin](https://github.com/onsah) actively tested uniqueness mode implementation, reporting unexpected behavior between LSP and compiler ([#44](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/44)) and inquiring about borrowing operator implementation status ([#43](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/43))
- [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) provided authoritative updates on borrowing implementation timeline and current status, explaining priority shifts away from unique mode features ([#43](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/43))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) identified and reported local switch creation issues with dune-project compatibility ([#42](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/42))
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) provided technical analysis of dune build flag behavior and suggested solutions for local switch issues ([#42](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/42))

summaries.brief_summary: Repository faced compilation issues with OCaml 5.2.0+flambda2 across several packages including alcotest, utop, and topkg
summaries.new_features_summary: New package release v0.18~preview.130.26+1192 for Jane Street ecosystem with new packages basement, command_nodejs, and oxcaml_effect
summaries.new_features:
- **Version release** v0.18~preview.130.26+1192 of the Jane Street package ecosystem delivered **new packages** including basement, command_nodejs, and oxcaml_effect alongside **package updates** for 300+ packages ([fab2717b](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/fab2717b1806f269a2b538e8b489fc4a797b4139))
- **New package basement** providing foundational utilities for the Jane Street ecosystem
- **New package command_nodejs** enabling Node.js integration for command-line tools
- **New package oxcaml_effect** supporting effect handling capabilities
- **Package removals** for ppx_python and several previous version packages as part of the ecosystem cleanup
summaries.activity_summary: Week focused on package compatibility issues with OCaml 5.2.0+flambda2 affecting compilation across multiple packages
summaries.activity:
- **Build compatibility issues** reported by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) with alcotest failing to compile due to local/global value constraints in OCaml 5.2.0+flambda2 ([#41](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/41))
- **utop compilation problems** in with-extensions branch identified by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) involving missing pattern matching for Misplaced_attribute ([#39](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/39))
- **Local switch creation issues** when dune-project files are present reported by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) due to unsupported dune version constraints ([#42](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/42))
- **Architecture-specific build failures** for ocaml-intrinsics-kernel on aarch64 linux discovered by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) with missing builtin recognition errors ([#40](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/40))
- **topkg compilation errors** in both with-extensions branches due to portable/nonportable value mismatches reported by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) ([#38](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/38))
summaries.discussions_summary: Technical discussions around dune project file discovery behavior and temporary fixes for compiler compatibility
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Dune project discovery** discussion between [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) and [Stefan Muenzel](https://github.com/smuenzel) regarding dune's upward search behavior for project files and potential sandboxing solutions ([#42](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/42))
- **Temporary fixes** provided by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) for ocaml-intrinsics-kernel build issues on ARM64 pending compiler upgrade ([#40](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/40))
summaries.trends_summary: Pattern of OCaml 5.2.0+flambda2 compatibility challenges across Jane Street ecosystem packages
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.2.0+flambda2 compatibility** challenges emerging as a consistent theme across multiple packages requiring updates for new compiler features
- **ARM64 architecture support** gaps becoming apparent with intrinsics-related packages needing specific attention
- **Dune version constraints** causing friction in development environments with newer dune versions
summaries.contributors_summary: Community contributors identified build issues while Jane Street maintainer provided fixes for compatibility problems
summaries.contributors:
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) reported alcotest compilation failures with OCaml 5.2.0+flambda2 ([#41](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/41))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) identified and reported three separate build issues affecting utop, local switch creation, and topkg compilation ([#39](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/39), [#42](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/42), [#38](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/38))
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) discovered ocaml-intrinsics-kernel build failures on aarch64 linux platform ([#40](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/40))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided fixes for topkg compilation issues and temporary workarounds for ARM64 intrinsics problems
- [Stefan Muenzel](https://github.com/smuenzel) contributed technical analysis of dune project discovery behavior and potential solutions

summaries.brief_summary: Two PRs opened for ARM64 and async_ssl compatibility fixes targeting modern toolchain support
summaries.activity_summary: Two new PRs opened addressing ARM64 build compatibility and async_ssl patches for modern toolchains
summaries.activity:
- **ARM64 compatibility fixes** opened by [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) including backport for ARM64 runtime assembly bug ([#36](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/36)) and async_ssl patch for modern toolchain support ([#37](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/37))
- Both PRs target **build system improvements** for newer development environments, with the ARM64 fix addressing assembly directive mismatch and async_ssl patch enabling compilation on ARM64 Linux systems
summaries.contributors_summary: Matthew Else opened two PRs focused on build compatibility improvements for modern toolchains
summaries.contributors: - [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) opened ARM64 build fix backporting oxcaml/oxcaml#3533 for runtime assembly directive correction ([#36](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/36)) and async_ssl compatibility patch referencing janestreet/async_ssl#39 for ARM64 Linux build support ([#37](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/37))

summaries.brief_summary: Single issue reported about odoc compilation failure with OCaml compiler variants
summaries.activity_summary: One new issue opened regarding compilation problems with odoc package
summaries.activity: - **Compilation issue** reported by [Patrick Nicodemus](https://github.com/patrick-nicodemus) for odoc package failing with OCaml variants.5.2.0+flambda2 compiler ([#35](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/35))
summaries.contributors_summary: [Patrick Nicodemus](https://github.com/patrick-nicodemus) reported compilation issue with detailed error logs
summaries.contributors: - [Patrick Nicodemus](https://github.com/patrick-nicodemus) opened issue [#35](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/35) reporting odoc compilation failure with OCaml variants.5.2.0+flambda2, providing detailed error logs showing constructor argument mismatches and type errors

summaries.brief_summary: macOS compatibility fixes merged and build issues resolved for bleeding-edge-with-extensions
summaries.activity_summary: macOS sigwait patch merged while OCaml 5.2 package updates closed pending upstream fixes
summaries.activity:
- **macOS compatibility** restored with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) merging sigwait patch for oxcaml compilers ([#34](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/34))
- **OCaml 5.2 package updates** by [Nick Roberts](https://github.com/ncik-roberts) closed without merging pending upstream dependency fixes including ocamlbuild 0.15.0+jst ([#31](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/31)) and starter packages for with-extensions-dev branch ([#32](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/32))
- **Build compatibility issues** resolved for bleeding-edge-with-extensions with [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) closing long-standing merlin and uuseg compilation problems ([#27](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/27))
- **dune macOS thread issues** fixed by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) addressing Thread.wait_signal errors on M2 chips ([#29](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/29))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on macOS M2 compatibility and OCaml 5.2 preparation across Jane Street toolchain
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **macOS M2 compatibility** improvements targeting thread signal handling and sigwait implementation issues across Jane Street's OCaml compiler variants
- **OCaml 5.2 preparation** efforts with package ecosystem updates for merlin, lsp, utop, and ocamlformat requiring coordination with upstream branch stabilization
summaries.contributors_summary: Anil Madhavapeddy handled macOS fixes while Nick Roberts worked on OCaml 5.2 package updates
summaries.contributors:
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) merged macOS sigwait compatibility patch for oxcaml compilers ([#34](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/34)) and resolved dune thread signal issues on M2 chips ([#29](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/29))
- [Nick Roberts](https://github.com/ncik-roberts) prepared OCaml 5.2 compatibility updates including ocamlbuild 0.15.0+jst ([#31](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/31)) and starter packages for with-extensions-dev ([#32](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/32))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided issue resolution and coordination with upstream flambda-backend fixes for compilation problems ([#27](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/27))
- [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) tested new release functionality and provided positive feedback on bleeding-edge-with-extensions compatibility improvements
- [Yaron Minsky](https://github.com/yminsky) originally reported merlin and utop build failures that were addressed this week
- [KC Sivaramakrishnan](https://github.com/kayceesrk) reported dune macOS threading issues and confirmed resolution

summaries.brief_summary: Major compiler update with macOS dune crash fix and extensive package version bumps across Jane Street libraries
summaries.new_features_summary: macOS sigwait patch fixing dune crashes and major compiler toolchain update
summaries.new_features:
- **macOS sigwait patch** added to fix dune crashes on M2 MacBook Pro systems by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([#34](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/34))
- **Compiler toolchain update** with extensive package version bumps from v0.18~preview.129.38+45 to v0.18~preview.130.04+450 by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#33](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/33))
- **New PPX packages** introduced including `ppx_rope`, `ppx_shorthand`, and `ppx_template` for enhanced code generation capabilities
- **Enhanced bonsai framework** with new `bonsai_concrete` package and updated web components
- **Updated gen_js_api** with new patches for better JavaScript interoperability and js_of_ocaml globalThis support
summaries.activity_summary: Two merged PRs addressing critical macOS compatibility and comprehensive package updates
summaries.activity:
- **macOS compatibility fix** merged by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) resolving dune crashes on Apple M2 systems through sigwait patch implementation ([#34](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/34))
- **Major compiler update** completed by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) involving 89 changed files and 32,000+ additions across the Jane Street package ecosystem ([#33](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/33))
- **Issue resolution** for long-standing macOS dune error reported by [KC Sivaramakrishnan](https://github.com/kayceesrk) and fixed through the sigwait patch ([#29](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/29))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on macOS compatibility and systematic package ecosystem updates
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Platform compatibility emphasis** with dedicated fixes for macOS-specific issues affecting developer workflow
- **Systematic package management** through coordinated version bumps across the entire Jane Street ecosystem
- **Enhanced web development support** with new bonsai components and improved JavaScript interoperability tools
summaries.contributors_summary: Three contributors involved in critical fixes and major updates
summaries.contributors:
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) implemented the macOS sigwait patch fixing dune crashes and provided the solution for the reported compatibility issue ([#34](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/34))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) executed the comprehensive compiler toolchain update affecting 89 files across the Jane Street package ecosystem ([#33](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/pull/33))
- [KC Sivaramakrishnan](https://github.com/kayceesrk) reported the macOS dune compatibility issue that was subsequently resolved ([#29](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/29))

summaries.brief_summary: Three PRs opened for OCaml 5.2 compatibility and tooling improvements, all awaiting resolution
summaries.activity_summary: Three new PRs opened addressing OCaml 5.2 compatibility and development tooling enhancements

- **OCaml 5.2 compatibility work** initiated by [Nick Roberts](https://github.com/ncik-roberts) with ocamlbuild update ([#31](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/31)) fixing 5.2+flambda support and starter packages fixes ([#32](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/32)) including patched versions of merlin, lsp, utop, and ocamlformat
- **Development tooling** exploration with draft PR adding merlin/lsp packages ([#30](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/30)) for testing and demonstration purposes
summaries.contributors_summary: Nick Roberts opened three PRs focusing on OCaml 5.2 compatibility and development tooling
summaries.contributors: - [Nick Roberts](https://github.com/ncik-roberts) opened three PRs addressing OCaml 5.2 compatibility issues including ocamlbuild fixes for 5.2+flambda ([#31](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/31)), comprehensive starter package updates with patched merlin, lsp, utop, and ocamlformat versions ([#32](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/32)), and exploratory merlin/lsp integration work ([#30](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/30))
